title: Narrative Point of View Schema
description: Standardized enumeration of narrative perspective approaches in The Shadow Team Chronicles universe.

descriptions.description: Detailed explanations of each narrative point of view (not part of the enum, provided for documentation)

first_person.description: Narration from one character's perspective using 'I' and 'we', limited to that character's knowledge and observations.

second_person.description: Narration that addresses the reader as 'you', placing them directly in the story as a participant.

third_person_limited.description: Narration using 'he', 'she', 'they' that follows one character closely, limited to that character's thoughts and perceptions.

third_person_omniscient.description: Narration that has access to the thoughts, feelings, and motivations of any character in the story.

multi_perspective.description: Narration that alternates between different character viewpoints, typically in different chapters or sections.

unreliable_narrator.description: Narration from a perspective that cannot be fully trusted, due to bias, dishonesty, or limited understanding.

objective_observer.description: Third-person narration that reports only external observations without access to any character's thoughts or feelings.

epistolary.description: Narration composed of documents such as letters, diary entries, news articles, or other records.

stream_of_consciousness.description: Narration that attempts to replicate the natural flow of thoughts, impressions, and associations in a character's mind.

collective_voice.description: Narration that speaks from the perspective of a group or community using 'we'.

usageGuidelines.description: Recommendations for when to use different points of view (not part of the enum, provided for documentation)

first_person.description: Best for character-driven narratives, personal accounts, and creating immediate emotional connection. Provides authenticity but limits the reader to one perspective.

third_person_limited.description: Most versatile POV, offering balance between character intimacy and narrative flexibility. Excellent for stories focusing on character development.

third_person_omniscient.description: Ideal for complex narratives with multiple key characters or when societal/historical context is important. Requires careful handling to avoid confusing perspective shifts.

multi_perspective.description: Suited for storylines with multiple central characters, particularly when showing contrasting viewpoints of the same events is important.
